intro: Pyrus achras f. ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous pear, is a rare horticultural form of the pear tree. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring a distinct pattern of lobing and a contrasting coloration on the upper and lower surfaces. The plant is typically found in cultivation rather than in the wild, due to its limited natural distribution. It exhibits a compact growth habit with a rounded crown, making it suitable for small garden spaces. While it shares the basic structure of its parent species, its ambiguous traits make it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
